question: Which one of the following was worshipped as a heavenly God by ancient Indians?
explanation: Surya is the Hindu god of the Sun. He is considered the creator of the universe and the source of all life. He is the supreme soul who brings light and warmth to the world. The god\'s most famous temple is at Konarak in Orissa, north-east India but he was worshipped across the Indian subcontinent.
